name: Infinite Combinations
description: Phlox normally delights in his work and the different species it brings him into contact with. But with Starfleet medical officers stretched thin, even the resilient Denobulan is feeling the strain. A returning foe may push him over the edge.
rules:
-- This is a single phase event! The phase will last for 96 hours.
-- In a Voyage Event, you will engage in Voyages with ocassional Voyage Encounters that will test proficiencies of your voyage crew.
-- In this event, Gold and Silver skills for Voyages will be DIP and SCI.
-- Voyage Encounters take place at the following points in time: 1 minute, 5 minutes, 15 minutes, 30 minutes, 45 minutes, 1 hour, 1.5 hours, 2 hours, and every 2 hours after that.
-- Passing a Voyage Encounter without losing any contests raises the multiplier for Victory Points gained in contests. Losing a contest resets this multiplier.
-- Three of the following traits are randomly chosen for each Encounter: Inspiring, Explorer, Scoundrel, Casual, Playful, Hero, Marksman, Investigator. Using crew with matching traits increases their Crit Chance in contests.
-- Using Evil Doctor, any version of Phlox, T-Ana, Pollard, Physicians, or Nurses will provide a bonus to antimatter and a permanent multiplier to passively gained Victory Points.
-- Using the S.S. Eleos XII, the Vidiian Warship, the Borg Sphere, or ships with the Freighter trait will provide a bonus to antimatter.
-- Earn Event Victory Points passively by running a voyage, and actively by winning contests during Voyage Encounters. The amount you earn increases with every Voyage Encounter passed. 
-- Collect Event Victory Points to unlock Threshold Rewards!
-- In this event, Squadrons may also compete to advance up the Squadron leaderboards. Join a Squadron to get more rewards!
bonus_text: Bonus: Freighter (Ship trait), Evil Doctor, Phlox, T-Ana, Pollard, Physicians, or Nurses

featured_crew.name: Sarah
featured_crew.flavor: During her life, Sarah made many inventions. When the opportunity to do life over again arose, she realized that there was no need.

action.name: It Gave All Of Us A Second Life

featured_crew.name: T'Ana
featured_crew.flavor: Tâ€™Ana goes down into the cave to get a medicinal fern.

featured_crew.name: Pollard
featured_crew.flavor: After traveling to the 32nd century with the rest of the U.S.S. Discovery crew, Dr. Pollard continues her mission to save lives.

rewards.flavor: Dilithium is your most valuable asset. Use Dilithium in the Time Portal to acquire valuable crew members, items, and more.

rewards.name: Honor
rewards.flavor: Honor is gained by dismissing crew who have served you well, but are ready for reassignment. Redeem in the Time Portal for exclusive crew, special fusion-related items, training programs, and more.

rewards.name: Merits
rewards.flavor: Merits can be earned by completing missions. Use Merits to acquire faction-based rewards, upgrades to your ship, and more.

rewards.name: Training
rewards.flavor: Increases crew XP by 2500.

rewards.name: Sarah
rewards.flavor: During her life, Sarah made many inventions. When the opportunity to do life over again arose, she realized that there was no need.

action.name: It Gave All Of Us A Second Life

rewards.name: Pollard
rewards.flavor: After traveling to the 32nd century with the rest of the U.S.S. Discovery crew, Dr. Pollard continues her mission to save lives.

rewards.name: Rarity
rewards.flavor: Contains ONE of the following 5 Polestars: Common, Uncommon, Rare, Super rare, Legendary

rewards.name: Skill

screens.text: "You know, Captain, normally the idea of having the same patient from three disparate timelines would prove an exciting research opportunity for me."
"But considering I've got another patient from six different timelines, all experiencing the same ailment, as well as two parallel universe patients, I find myself more exhausted than exhilarated."

"It seems we're all stretched thin. The temporal anomalies were exciting from a scientific standpoint at first; now they've brought with them all manner of medical malady. I have so many patients, I can barely keep them straight. And I can't remember the last time I had a break."

"The last 'break' I had was when I got so mad at an idiot from the mirror universe, I snapped a tricorder in half. Eh, damn things are flimsy anyway. Captain, we're struggling out here. Think you and your crew can give us a hand?"
"You know, Captain, normally the idea of having the same patient from three disparate timelines would prove an exciting research opportunity for me."
"But considering I've got another patient from six different timelines, all experiencing the same ailment, as well as two parallel universe patients, I find myself more exhausted than exhilarated."

"It seems we're all stretched thin. The temporal anomalies were exciting from a scientific standpoint at first; now they've brought with them all manner of medical malady. I have so many patients, I can barely keep them straight. And I can't remember the last time I had a break."

"The last 'break' I had was when I got so mad at an idiot from the mirror universe, I snapped a tricorder in half. Eh, damn things are flimsy anyway. Captain, we're struggling out here. Think you and your crew can give us a hand?"
